isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 5000, 9100, 9200, 9400, AND 9900 MODELS - CATERPILLAR C-10, C-12 AND 3406E ENGINES - OPERATION - SERVICE BRAKE SWITCH

svcproc.title: SERVICE BRAKE SWITCH
svcproc.para: Circuit 97AL is an input to the ECM through connector (400) terminal 45. The ground or common side of the service brake switch is connected through circuits 97-GF, 97-GA and 97-G to connector (400) terminal 29. With service brakes released(switch closed), the ECM sees 0 volts at connector (400) terminal 5. Applying the brakes opens the switch, and the ECM sees 5 volts at terminal 14.
